contentList.content: A stylish hood adorned with intricate whiskey-themed embroidery.
Flowing robes made from a special, enchanted fabric that shimmers like a fine whiskey.
These gloves are adorned with miniature whiskey barrels on the knuckles.
Sturdy boots with whiskey-colored leather and intricate whiskey cask motifs.
An amulet with a tiny, sparkling whiskey cask pendant.
A cloak that shimmers like the ripples of whiskey in a glass.
This is HUGE. Grants excessive knowledge of porpoises and was once worn by Joe Exotic.
Grants advantage on saving throws against spells that involve fire.
Provides resistance to fire damage and grants advantage on Charisma (Persuasion) checks when attempting to negotiate over a drink.
Grants the wearer resistance to cold damage, as if they've been fortified by the warmth of a fine whiskey.
Once per day, the wearer can conjure a small wellspring of whiskey that can be used to restore 1d8 hit points when consumed.
When the wearer casts a spell related to fire or alcohol, the cloak billows dramatically, granting a +2 bonus to their spell save DC.
Your unarmed attacks deal an additional 1d8 force damage and have a chance of making you drunk.
A spell that creates a FireWine barrel? THAT'S HUGE!
